Package userinterface

Class BookmarksBar

java.lang.Object
userinterface.AbstractFrame
userinterface.BookmarksBar
public class BookmarksBar
extends AbstractFrame
A class to represent a graphical area that displays the currently saved bookmarks, along with providing the option of clicking on one of the bookmarks to navigate to the associated URL.

      public BookmarksBar​(int x, int y, int width, int height, int offset) throws IllegalDimensionException
      Initialize this BookmarksBar with the given parameters.
      Parameters:
      x - : The x coordinate of this BookmarksBar.
      y - : The y coordinate of this BookmarksBar.
      width - : The width of this BookmarksBar
      height - : The height of this BookmarksBar
      offset - : The distance that will be used as padding in-between saved bookmarks.

      IllegalDimensionException

      y - : the y coordinate of the mouse activity.
      clickCount - : the number of clicks.
      button - : the mouse button that was clicked.
      modifiersEx - : the control keys that were held on the click.

      keyCode - : The KeyEvent code (Determines the involved key)
      keyChar - : The character representation of the involved key
      modifiersEx - : Specifies other keys that were involved in the event

    • handleResize

      public void handleResize​(int newWindowWidth, int newWindowHeight)
      This method handles resizes. It makes sure the addressBar is adjusted in width when the window shrinks or grows. It does not change its height (e.g. look at Firefox).

      N.B.: without this method, BookmakrBar would be rendered with the given absolute width, and thus one would need to guess the correct initial size of the window. Using this method, widths are automatically adjusted: both at initialization and at runtime.

      Specified by:
      handleResize in class AbstractFrame
      Parameters:
      newWindowHeight - : parameter containing the new window-height
      newWindowWidth - : parameter containing the new window-width

    • loadTextHyperlink

      public void loadTextHyperlink​(java.lang.String linkName)
      Load a UITextHyperlink located in this BookmarksBar by retrieving its associated href-value out of the domain layer.
      Parameters:
      linkName - : the name of the link that needs to be loaded.

    • getTextHyperLinks

      public java.util.ArrayList<UITextHyperlink> getTextHyperLinks()
      Retrieve the list of bookmarks represented as UITextHyperlink's associated to this BookmarksBar.
